text: hi anybody can explain why all the UX pages work perfectly EXCEPT for “machines” which since yesterday stays at “loading machines”
<@U8A2N44HH> if you are on the github URL then you may have hit a bug w/ a new feature.  Login to <https://portal.rackn.io> -> that version of the UX is more stable
if you know how to look at your browser's dev tools, it would be helpful to know which network call(s) are failing on your system
<@U8A2N44HH> do your machine run's gohai to get inventory information?  that could also be the issue.  the new code shows machine inventory values on the machines page
Yes @lae
Likely. Working to cut 3.7 soon

<@U02DHRR2L> thanks switched to <http://portal.rackn.io|portal.rackn.io> and issue was cleared. As per Gohai, only runs as part of discovery yet … haven’t played to much with it yet. Havin’ a ball with workflows right now :smile:
is <http://portal.rackn.io|portal.rackn.io> going to be set as the default for drp stable at least?
<@U54E4SD4G> yes
on v3.7.0 release that will be the default redirect and is the "production" UX endpoint
got it, that way it makes sense
and I guess tip would stay the same?
yep - a little bit of a chicken-and-egg issue getting the versioned UX Endpoints in place and ready to make the switch in the DRP side
tip will still point to portal.  You can change portal to latest to get the better edge.

text: going forward; the github UX Endpoint will always be the "most recent (master) ... and probably a lil bit unstable"

we'll control UX updates via the following flow: 
<http://rackn.github.io|rackn.github.io> - latest master; unstable
<http://latest.rackn.io|latest.rackn.io> - will be like DRP "tip" - generally stable latest features
<http://portal.rackn.io|portal.rackn.io> - production released version
